title: Unit 6 Checkpoint: Circles
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of circle fundamentals (circumference, area), arc length, sector area, the Inscribed Angle Theorem and its corollaries, and tangent-radius relationships.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: C=2πr=πd, A=πr², working backwards from C or A to find r
A=πr² (uses r², not d), distinguish area (squared units) from circumference (linear units)
Arc length = (θ/360)×2πr, fraction of circumference, working backwards to find θ
Sector area = (θ/360)×πr², fraction of total area, same fraction control as arc length
Inscribed = half central, semicircle→90°, inscribed quad opposite angles supplementary
Tangent⊥radius, tangent-chord angle = half intercepted arc

assessmentProblems.question: A circle has radius 9. Find the circumference and area in terms of π.
A circle has area 196π. Find the radius, diameter, and circumference.
A circle has radius 15 and a central angle of 60°. Find the arc length.
A circle has radius 8 and a central angle of 135°. Find the sector area in terms of π.
An arc has length 10π on a circle with radius 20. Find the central angle.
A central angle measures 130°. Find the inscribed angle that intercepts the same arc.
Quadrilateral ABCD is inscribed in a circle. ∠A = (4x - 5)° and ∠C = (2x + 35)°. Find x, ∠A, and ∠C.
Tangent PA touches circle O at point A. OA = 8 and OP = 17. Find the length of tangent PA.
assessmentProblems.answer: Tangent⊥radius: PA² + OA² = OP² → PA² + 64 = 289 → PA² = 225 → PA = 15. (8-15-17 Pythagorean triple.)

assessmentProblems.question: A circle has radius 12. A sector has a central angle of 120°. Find (a) the arc length and (b) the perimeter of the sector (arc + two radii).

ANALYSIS: A circular garden has circumference 40π feet. A sprinkler at the center waters a sector with a central angle of 108°. Find (a) the radius, (b) the total area of the garden, (c) the area watered, and (d) the area NOT watered.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) C=2πr=40π → r=20 ft. (b) A=π(20²)=400π ft². (c) Fraction=108/360=3/10. Watered=3/10×400π=120π ft². (d) Not watered=400π-120π=280π ft².

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Quadrilaterals): A rhombus has diagonals of 24 and 10. Find the length of each side.
SPIRAL (Pythagorean Converse): A triangle has sides 9, 12, and 16. Classify it as acute, right, or obtuse.
